direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're an understandin' fella.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, this is the last time I see you then unless I do bad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, this one doesn't count. It's part of the original one. So then ... until we meet again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Adam gets in his car and drives off leaving the Cowboy smiling behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. HOLLYWOOD - MORNING We see the rays of the rising sun falling on the huge letters of the HOLLYWOOD SIGN and the hills surrounding it. CUT TO: INT.  AUNT RUTH'S APARTMENT. - MORNING We see Rita's face as we hear Betty off screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "You're still here?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: came back. I thought that's what you wanted." We see Betty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Nobody wants you here!" Moving back we realize that the girls are acting out Betty's audition scene. Rita is reading her lines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Really?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "My parents are right upstairs! They think you've left..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "So... surprise"...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: can call them... I can call my dad... " RITA "But you won't..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "You're playing a dangerous game here. If you're trying to blackmail me... it's not going to work."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "You know what I want...it's not that difficult."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Get out! Get out before I call my dad ... he trusts you ... your his best friend. This will be the end of everything... " RITA "What about you? What will your dad think about you?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Stop! Just Stop! That's what you said from the beginning. If I tell what happened... they'll arrest you and put you in jail, so get out of here before..."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Before what?" Betty pulls a table knife out from behind her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Before I kill you."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Then they'd put you in jail." Betty mimes with moving fingers tears flowing from her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cry, cry, cry, and then I say with big emotion, "I hate you... I hate us both!" Betty drops the kitchen knife and both girls start laughing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Such a lame scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you are really good. Betty mimes tapping a cigarette in a cigarette holder ala Dietrich.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you dahling!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. COCO'S APARTMENT - DAY On the move Coco is just bringing her cigarette in its holder up to her painted red lips. The phone is ringing and she's crossing the room to answer it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello ... Ruthie... How's the great up north? ... Oh, I'm sorry to hear it ... what? Well, I haven't seen her if she's in there. Now, Ruthie there's nothing to worry about. I saw Betty last night and she was just fine. Yes, and I gave them to her. She's a real nice kid, Ruthie. Now stop worrying, will ya. I'll go over and have a look around. I will. I've got the production office number. I'll find you. Now keep your socks on up there and take lots of "C." Goodbye honey. Coco puts down the receiver with a long sigh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. AUNT RUTH'S APARTMENT - DAY Betty and Rita are sitting on the leather couch having some coffee. The front door to the apartment is open and sunlight is pouring in through the screen door. Betty looks at her watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no wonder I'm starving. I'm going to fix a sandwich. You want one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm all right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got to eat something. You're just nervous about going over to see if you're Diane Selwyn. Rita just looks at her. Betty starts for the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suit yourself. I'll share mine with you if you change your mind. Betty goes into the kitchen. Suddenly there's a knock on the screen door and Coco peers in, seeing Rita on the couch. Rita looks up ... panicked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi! Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh...Betty!? Betty comes out from the kitchen and sees the situation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I see you outside a minute Betty? Betty walks past Rita, pats her on the shoulder and goes outside to see Coco who has moved away to wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. COURTYARD 1612 HAVENHURST - DAY The screen door slams. Coco and Betty face each other close, out of earshot of Rita.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your Aunt called me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was afraid of that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wants to know who's staying in her apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just for a night or two, until she finds her own place. I tried to explain that to Aunt Ruth, but the connection was bad and her plane was leaving and she got it all mixed up. I kept telling her it was my friend and she kept saying she didn't know any Ritas ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweetie, look at me straight. Betty lifts her eyes to Coco's. Direct, clear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Coco...she's very nice. We went to school together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I guess your Grandpa and Grandma know her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not really. I met her in junior college and she was from this other town. Coco looks hard into Betty's innocent face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can call my grandparents ... I'm sure they'd tell you that I don't lie and I sure wouldn't allow a stranger to invade my Aunt Ruth's apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Honey... I was married to a director for thirty years. He had an uncanny ability to read people. Maybe some of it rubbed off on me or maybe I had it all along ... you're a good kid... What you're telling me is a load of horse - pucky but it comes from a good place. I'll trust you to sort this out. Now I'm not going against Ruth. She's got enough to worry about up there in Canada. If she asks- I'm going to say everything is okay, and you make sure it is. (Coco places her hand on Betty's shoulder and squeezes it) If you need any help you know where to find me. Betty puts her hand on Coco's shoulder and gives her a squeeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're really something Coco...thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't make me out to be a sucker. Louise Bonner says there's trouble in there. You remember last night. Sometimes she's wrong, but if there is trouble - get rid of it. Coco turns and walks away. Betty studies her and thinks about what she said before turning and going back inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. AUNT RUTH'S APARTMENT - SAME Betty enters through the screen door. Rita studies her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is everything all right? Is it bad for you that I'm here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everything is A-okay, but I've gotta get that sandwich! On her way to the kitchen she checks her watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I've got an audition in one hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. HOLLYWOOD POLICE STATION - DAY Detective Neal Domgaard throws two wallets down on the desk in front of Detective Harry McKnight. Harry pauses in the middle of a large bite of grilled cheese sandwich with bacon and tomato. He looks down and studies the wallets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice wallets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Handstitched Italian. Filled with phony credit cards ... off the two guys in the Caddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The one of 'em still alive?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... just .... Dr. Scott's got 'im. You remember Dr.Scott.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well he said...  you know in his way... you know what I mean? Besides the guy gettin' rolled up under the kids car which busted him up pretty bad, there was this little knife-like torn piece of metal, you know, off the car body, rolled out and slid up through this guy's neck and just kinda slit his aorta, you know, but they didn't find it right away, so the guy's losin' a lot of blood, you know, to the brain - all this time cause it was just like this thin little puncture wound on the surface of his neck that kinda sealed itself, he said, while inside the aorta is bleedin' pretty steady all that time. So, Dr. Scott's laughin' you know like he does 'cause he knows we want to talk to this guy. He's laughin' you know and shakin'... Son of a bitch couldn't stop laughin'... It was kinda contagious 'cause pretty soon we were all laughin'...the nurse was laughin'. You know how he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Find out who they are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nope, not yet. Their fingerprints don't match up anywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Interesting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah ... and they both use the same address.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where at?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Palmdale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn, that's a long drive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. -  COURTYARD 1612 HAVENHURST - DAY Betty is coming out of Aunt Ruth's apartment. She calls back in to Rita.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope I'm back in a couple of hours. Don't drink all the coke. (we hear laughter from inside and Rita call out.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I get back I'll have the cab waiting, so be ready to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Betty closes the door and heads across the courtyard. She knocks on Coco's door and in a moment Coco answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry to trouble you, Coco.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all right gorgeous. Something wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no. I'm on my way to my audition. Before I go I wanted to ask you if you could remember the man's name ... Aunt Ruthie's friend who helped put this together. It completely went out of my mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His name's Wally Brown .... great guy. Been in the business since forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks Coco. It'd be so embarrassing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naw! He wouldn't have cared. Just give him a good performance and he'll be happy and I've got a feeling you'll do just that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks Coco. I'll let you know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get going. You don't want to be late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. See ya.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck, honey! Betty takes off through the iron gates and Coco smiles as she watches her go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. CAB - DAY Betty is wide-eyed and filled with awe at something she is seeing. CUT TO: EXT. - PARAMOUNT STUDIOS - MAIN ENTRANCE GATE - DAY The cab pulls up to the gate. Betty pays the driver and gets out. She-stands for a moment staring at a dream. She walks through the gate and as she goes is stopped by a PARAMOUNT GUARD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And where do we think we're going, Miss? Betty stops and turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To my audition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And who are we auditioning for today?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wally Brown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And do we know which of the fifty-seven buildings Wally Brown is in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, now we've got to figure that out first don't we?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr.Wallace Brown is in the Executive Building on the second floor. We want to go in and turn right at the first street. Then we want to walk three blocks down past Stage 17 to the white Executive Building. Once we're on the second floor the receptionist will take us from there. Now do we have name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Betty Elms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see if we have a pass for Betty Elms ... and we do. Here we go. And good luck Miss. Elms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you... thank you very much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT.   EXECUTIVE BUILDING - SECOND FLOOR - DAY Betty finishes climbing some stairs and crosses to the receptionist. She hands over her pass. The receptionist looks at it, hands it back to Betty and points down the hall to her left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Number 43, on the left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Betty walks down the long corridor past several offices. The door to office 43 is open when she arrives and she enters a large sitting room with a receptionist at a desk off to one side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is Betty Elms. I'm here to audition for... Mr. Brown
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. Perfect timing. Have a seat and I'll get Mr. Brown. The receptionist stands, walks to a door, knocks twice, then enters. She closes the door behind her and Betty is alone in the sitting room. She sits on a couch and looks at the old movie posters covering all four walls. In a moment the same door opens again and an elderly, distinguished looking gentleman WALLY BROWN comes out smiling. Betty stands up immediately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Betty Elms?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm Wally Brown. Your Aunt is a very dear friend of mine so it's particularly nice to meet you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very pleased to meet you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in. I'd like you to meet everyone. As they walk into Wally's office...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I took the liberty of inviting an extra person to see your audition. She saw your resume picture and was very interested in meeting you. Inside Wally's office several people rise out of chairs when Wally enters with Betty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Betty Elms this is Jack Taft, my assistant, Jimmy Katz who we've already cast for the part of "Chuck". He'll be doing the scene with you. This is Julie Chadwick and Bob Brooker, the director, and our surprise guest is Sarah James. We couldn't afford her to cast our picture, but as casting agents go she's the best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why thank you, Wally. Hello Betty. She and Betty shake hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pleased to meet you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Nicki, my assistant. Nicki, a very stylish, thin girl with black cat-eyed glasses nods coolly to Betty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this is Martha, Martha Johnson, who you met out front. Betty nervously smiles to the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well. Shall we get to it? Would you like a water or a coffee before we begin? Betty's hands are beginning to sweat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no, I'm fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well then, take a seat everyone. Betty why don't you join Jimmy and we'll play the scene. Is there anything you'd like to say Bob... something to Betty before they begin? Betty stops on her way across to Jimmy and looks to Bob the director.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No ... it's not a contest, see, the two of them with themselves, so don't play it for real until it gets real. Betty doesn't know what to say. She catches Sarah's assistant, Nicki, rolling her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Betty continues walking toward Jimmy who opens his arms to her as she approaches. He's old enough to be her father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just tell me where it hurts, baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to play this one close, Bob. Like it was with that girl, what's her name, with the black hair. That felt good. Whaddya think? Betty looks from Jimmy to Bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That'd be good, Jimmy. Just don't rush that line again. I told you... the line where you say, "Before what?"
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was playin' off 'em. They say, "They'll arrest you"... and stuff like that.. "put you in jail"... they say it like that. They all say it the same way, so I react like that. Jimmy turns to Betty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look ... what's your name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Betty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah ... Betty. You don't rush it. I don't rush it. We play it close, just like in the movies. Jimmy reaches out and puts his arm around Betty and brings her in against his pot belly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dad's best friend goes to work. Jimmy smiles as he brings Betty a little closer. She is trying to concentrate through the nervousness and Jimmy's breath. There is a silence as Jimmy looks her in the eyes. Everyone in the room is looking Betty in the eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And ... ACTION! Betty and Jimmy start the scene. It is very difficult for Betty as Jimmy has her in an absurd clench now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're still here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I came back. I thought that's what you wanted. Jimmy plays this with a big lecherous smile. He gives the last part of the line across her cheek up to her ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody wants you here. Betty uses the anger of this line to push herself away from Jimmy. Jimmy reaches out and grabs her wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? Betty pulls her hand away and stands her ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My parents are right upstairs! They think you've left. Jimmy smiles broadly and moves again toward Betty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So ... surprise! Betty pushes him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can call them... I can call my dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you won't. He grabs Betty by the wrist again and pulls her in to him. He puts his hand on her waist and it accidently slips and keeps going down her hips. He jerks his hand back. Betty looks down and sees Jimmy's hand hovering above her thigh. Betty takes her hand and gently presses down on Jimmy's hand. She slowly looks up with the most seductive smile. Jimmy lets his hand rest more firmly on her thigh, and squeezes her thigh as he sees her smile. With his other hand Jimmy gently pulls her closer. Something has started coming over Betty and she catches the drift of this scene in a different way. She's surprising herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're playing a dangerous game here. if you're trying to blackmail me... it's not going to work. Jimmy now surprises himself. He becomes almost tender and genuinely worked up from the heat coming off Betty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I want...it's not that difficult. Where the scene should turn to anger from Betty it can't now and Betty plays it as she feels it. She stays in very close to Jimmy - looking him right in the eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out... Get out before I call my dad. He trusts you... you're his best friend. (her arms go around him) This will be the end of everything. Jimmy gets lost. He doesn't know where he is anymore. He can only see Betty's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about you? What will your dad think about you? Betty still playing it in a dreamy whisper... lost in heat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop... just stop! That's what you said from the beginning. If I tell what happened... they'll arrest you and put you in jail, so get out of here before...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before what? As scripted Betty pretends to pull the knife from behind her back, but wraps the knife around behind Jimmy and pulls him into a kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before I kill you. Jimmy panics and pushes Betty away with his hands on her shoulders as if forcing himself to come out of a trance. He finally is able to say his line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then they'd put you in jail. As scripted Betty is supposed to cry now and it is very easy for her to do this because she's ashamed at how the sex of the scene took her over. Tears begin running down her cheeks. She backs away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate you... I hate us both! She pretends to drop the knife. The scene ends. Everyone in the room has become mesmerized by Betty, but they soon drift back to reality and begin applauding the performance. Sarah turns to Nicki.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to take her over there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Big time!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow! Betty wipes her eyes and turns smiling - still shocked at herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, there it was.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There it was it was! Baby, you got a way!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bob?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very good. Really. I mean it was forced maybe but still humanistic. Yeah, very good, really.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, thank you Betty, and I mean that. That was very impressive. You've done your Aunt proud and I'm going to tell her the first chance I get. We'll speak again soon I'm sure, and thank you so much for coming in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, thank you. Betty doesn't quite know what to do. She moves to the center of the room and just stands. Remnants of the scene still staying with her. Sarah stands and Nicki stands just after.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Wally. I'm sure you all have a lot to talk about. We'll walk Betty out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, yes indeed. Our pleasure, Sarah, and don't you be a stranger. We'd love to see you around here again real soon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well come along, Betty. Sarah takes Betty's hand and they go to the door. Betty turns back once more and smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you again, Mr. Brown. It was nice meeting all of you. Everyone nods and waves and Betty is taken out by Sarah and Nicki.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT.- CORRIDOR EXECUTIVE BUILDING - DAY The three of them walk down the corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God, that was awful! Betty's head spins to Sarah. A look of shock and let down on her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, not you Betty. You were stellar and I mean that, but poor Wally. He'll never get that picture made. Wally's days were up twenty -years ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about that Jimmy Katz?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh god! Jimmy Katz never had a day. Jimmy Katz never had a minute. Poor Wally. Betty finds herself getting a little upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They seem very nice to me, and Wally... Mr. Brown is a very close friend of my Aunt's, so. . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Settle down, Betty. Don't get me wrong. I love Wally. I ought to. I was married to him for ten years. Betty does another shocked head turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I love actors, all actors, Jimmy Katz included. We just get a little catty sometimes. Now we want to take you across the way and introduce you to a director who's a head above the rest. He's got a project that you would kill! At the word 'kill' Betty turns to her once again with a questioning look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Knock it right out of the park.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. - RECORDING STUDIO - DAY We see what looks like a recording studio right out of the 1960's. We're looking through a plate of glass. A blonde girl is standing at a vintage microphone. Behind her are three back-up male vocalists dressed in three tone, shiny 60's suits. We hear strings soar up and the blonde girl begins to sing SIXTEEN REASONS by Connie Stevens. The male vocalists backing her up flawlessly. We move back and realize we are on a movie set inside a sound stage. A screen test is being shot of the girl and as we continue moving back we see the director Adam Kesher surrounded by his crew. Behind them there are many people standing, eating, watching, working. The stage is full and bustling. The song plays loudly over. Sarah and Nicki bring Betty into this scene through a giant stage door. A guard mimes for them to be quiet as they approach the set. The song continues to play over. As Sarah leads Betty up close Adam turns and his eyes fall on the beautiful face of Betty Elms. Sensing something Betty turns and sees Adam. They each seem to feel the thrill of the thunderbolt, but each embarrassed to stare longer than they already have turn back and watch the girl finish the song.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut it! He gets out of his chair and walks into the set - up to the blonde girl. He shakes her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you very much, Carol. It was really great of you to come in. I know how busy you are.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, man, are you kidding? I love this script! Where do I sign?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look... I love you, but there's no way they're gonna let me cast this thing until I've seen everyone. I'll let you know as soon as I can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you will ... cause my manager's gonna bug you day and night ... me too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll be my pleasure. Now, get out of here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you're just so cruel... don't forget me. I'm the girl that's going to play this part.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See ya later. Adam turns and goes back out of the set onto the stage floor. He looks around. He sees Betty being introduced by Sarah to some of the studio executives. He goes over to his Assistant Director and looks down at the man's notepad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's next, Hank?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Camilla Rhodes. Adam wonders - worries.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is she ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring her out. Hank speaks into his walkie-talkie headset. The sound of his voice can be heard in several locations throughout the stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Camilla Rhodes next! Adam looks up - a beautiful blonde steps into the set in front of the microphone. IT IS THE GIRL! The back-up singers step in behind her. Adam nods to Hank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn over! The cameraman calls out, "Speed".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Playback! Countdown before the music begins.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (caught by her transfixing, sultry eyes, and almost breathless ... he finds himself taking an extra long pause)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ! The strings soar up and Camilla Rhodes begins to sing. On the set Betty hears the song again and turns and watches. Once again her eyes find Adam as his eyes are finding hers. This time Adam turns away. He watches Camilla for a moment. She is passable, but not spectacular. Adam reaches out and pulls Hank over to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? Adam pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get Jason over here. Hank gets on his walkie-talkie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cindy ... Adam wants to see Jason. Adam continues to watch Camilla Rhodes sing. JASON GOLDWYN, a tall sixty year old silver-haired man, comes through the crowd and stops at Adam's side. He looks down at Adam, but Adam continues watching Camilla Rhodes. Jason follows Adam's gaze and he watches Camilla sing then turns back to Adam. Adam slowly looks up right into Jason's eyes - wondering how much Jason knows, but Jason's face doesn't give away a thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you want to tell me something, Adam?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the girl! At that moment Ray, having overheard, comes to Jason's side. He smiles at Adam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent choice, Adam. Adam is sick with himself. Across the room Betty panics when she looks at her watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh ... oh...I have to be somewhere. I promised a friend. She quickly shakes Sarah's and Nicki's hands saying, "I'm sorry, I'm sorry" and runs off like Cinderella. Adam turns and sees her running off out of his world. Chris Isaak's song "Except The New Girl" segues in over Connie Stevens and plays as Adam, Sarah and Nicki watch Betty disappear out the sound stage door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT.  1612 HAVENHURST - STREET - DAY Chris Isaak song "Except The New Girl" continues. An idling cab sits waiting with back door open. CUT TO: COURTYARD - 1612 HAVENHURST DAY Chris Isaak song segues to the sounds of a blues saxophone. Betty and Rita come out of Aunt Ruth's apartment. Betty is laughing, pulling on Rita.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mom. There's nothing to be afraid of. Across the courtyard CORNELL DUMONT, a strikingly handsome young black musician, is on his balcony playing the saxophone. He stops playing when he sees the girls. He stands and looks as if recognizing someone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Betty and Rita stop and look up, shielding their eyes from the sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, how's Sol?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sol?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No ... not you... (to Rita) I'm sorry... I forget your name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rita.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Well, I haven't seen Sol lately. Tell him to come by the club. Rita nods ... biting her lip. Cornell smiles and picks up his sax.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what's your name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cornell Dumont. He begins to blow some sweet jazz that flows smooth as syrup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ask him who Sol is ... Rita hurriedly starts for the gate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he could help... Betty follows Rita through the gate to the waiting cab. They get in and the cab pulls away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. CAB - DAY Betty reaches and gently grabs Rita's shoulder. She speaks firmly but quietly so the cab driver won't hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why didn't you ask him? Sol knows you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I don't know, Sol. I never heard of Sol. I'd just get in trouble. That's why we shouldn't go see about Diane Selwyn... it's better not to get in trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not going to get in trouble. You're going to find out who you are. Finding out who you are gets you out of trouble. Rita thinks about this silently then begins to worry and doubt all over again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. CAB - LATER Betty holds the slip of paper with the address in her hand. She turns back and forth watching the buildings on both sides of the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It should be around here... Rita watches out of the window pensively as the cab moves up Sierra Bonita. They near a modern apartment compound of bungalows and duplexes almost hidden in the trees and vegetation. A smooth stucco wall surrounds the complex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it ... 2590. (nudging Rita) Does it look familiar? Rita shakes her head..no. Rita is looking at a black car parked down the street facing 2590. She discerns two men sitting in the front.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't stop!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it? What do you see?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those men in front, in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know them?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep going. Go around to the back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. SIERRA BONITA APARTMENT - BACK ALLEY - DAY Betty gets Rita out of the cab and pays the driver, who then drives away. The girls go through a rear gate and enter the complex walking along a curving concrete walk. This leads them to an intersection where a registry is printed on a rough hewn wooden plaque. They scan the list.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Selwyn ... number 12. They both look around the various doors near them. Betty spots a sign which says, behind an arrow, bungalows #10 through #20.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's this way. They set off down another sidewalk toward Bungalow #12. As they near it and actually can see it just ahead they pass a chainlink service gate to the alley. Standing in the alley is a man in a dark suit wearing sunglasses. Both girls dive for the bushes. The man in the black suit turns reacting to the noise and motion. Both girls are trying to catch their breath and stay as still and quiet as possible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, you've got me scared. Peering through the bushes they see the man still looking in their direction. Suddenly he turns and smiles at something to his left. He hurries off, but soon returns carrying two heavy suitcases, followed by an older woman in a yellow dress. Both Betty and Rita crawl further forward. They see the limo and realize that the man they were afraid of is an ordinary limousine driver just going about his work. The girls stand up, relieved and a little embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, I told you there was nothing to be afraid of! They go up to Bungalow #12 and stand for a moment facing the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no ... don't. Betty doesn't listen to Rita. She knocks strongly on the door. They stand waiting. There's no answer so Betty knocks again harder. They wait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one's ... Suddenly the door opens. An attractive MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN stands before them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Diane?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Number 17.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it said #12.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I switched apartments with her. She's in #17. Just walk down that way. It's just to the right. The woman seems to be looking now at Rita.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's kind of hidden by the foliage. Betty and Rita start to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hasn't been around for a few days ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well ... we'll leave her a note.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll go with you. She's still got some of my stuff. The phone rings from inside her bungalow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh ... go ahead. I've got to get that. The woman hurries back inside and closes the door. Betty and Rita quickly move up the walkway toward Bungalow #17.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I guess you're not Diane. Rita, still fighting her fear doesn't answer. They reach Bungalow #17. It's set back beneath tall bushes and an old Eucalyptus tree. The front door is in deep shadow. Without even looking at Rita Betty knocks quickly. There's no answer. She knocks again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still not home I guess. The girls drift off to the side of the bungalow. Betty tries to see in the windows. She tries a window and to her surprise it opens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon help me in. I'll open the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. Betty jumps up and catches her knees on the siding, her head through the open window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! Rita reluctantly pushes and Betty is in. As she closes the window ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meet you at the door. Rita walks around to the front door and gets there just as Betty opens it. Betty has her hand over her mouth and nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know if you want to come in here or not. There's some kind of horrible smell like... something... Rita is compelled to go in and as the door clicks shut she reacts to the smell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. - BUNGALOW #17 - DAY Betty begins to go through the bungalow and Rita follows. All the blinds are closed and the curtains drawn. They move slowly, looking around at everything as they go. Betty looks to Rita to see if any of this is something she remembers. Rita looks as though she's walking in a trance. Through the half light they move deeper into the bungalow to a corridor. CUT TO: EXT. SIERRA BONITA APARTMENTS - BUNGALOW #12 - DAY The Middle-Aged Woman is just shutting the door to her bungalow. She walks quickly in the direction of Bungalow #17. CUT TO: INT. - BUNGALOW #17 - DAY Betty and Rita are moving down the corridor. They pass a small room and look in at a couch, wardrobe and make-up table. They move on down the corridor to a door which is almost closed. Betty touches the door and it seems to swing open on its own. They enter the room and stop cold. A scream starts to build inside Rita. Before them is a dead woman lying on a bed. Great chunks of mattress are standing upright having been ripped and torn by shotgun blasts. A dried sea of blood surrounds the bloated, gray body of the woman. The scream comes out of Rita as a force propelling her to look closer. Betty lunges after Rita, her eyes also not able to leave the sight. She covers Rita's mouth with her hand and brings her close. The scream is stifled by Betty's hand. In the silence that follows, knocking can be heard. Betty freezes and keeps Rita quiet with her hand still placed over her mouth, but she can't stop Rita's violent shaking nor the horror in her eyes. CUT TO: EXT. BUNGALOW #17 - DAY The Middle-Aged Woman backs away from the front door, looking around at bungalow #17. She's not sure if she has heard something or not. She wonders, then turns and goes back to her bungalow. Just as she has disappeared the door to Bungalow #17 flies open and Rita, followed closely behind by Betty, runs with a look of horror directly toward us until her tortured face fills the screen. Sounds, churning music. CUT TO: INT. AUNT RUTH'S APARTMENT - BATHROOM - DAY Sounds, music churning continues. Great sobs, almost hysterical, wrack Rita's body as she bends over the sink, scissoring into her long, dark hair with a frenzy. There is a loud sound of the scissors cutting deep through many strands of hair. Betty's is rushing to her - her hands reach tenderly, but firmly for Rita's hand holding the scissors. She keeps her from cutting and moves closer, whispering in Rita's ear. Rita can't stop crying, but lets Betty hold her. Music changes ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rita... I know what you're doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What ... I..HAVE... to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what you have to do, but let me do it. Rita turns and looks up at Betty, her eyes red with crying. Betty pulls her up facing her. Rita lets Betty take the scissors. They look into each other's eyes. Betty gently strokes Rita's cheek, wiping away some tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. AUNT RUTH'S APARTMENT - LATER - DAY Panning slowly across we see on the bathroom counter various open bottles, used Q-tips, towels, combs, a brush, a bowl, and lots of long strands of cut black hair. We continue moving up to an empty mirror and eerie music builds. The reflection of the new Rita moves into the mirror. She has short, beautiful blonde hair, blonde eyebrows and no make-up. Betty's reflection comes in beside Rita's. They stare at the new Rita in the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look like someone else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT. COURTYARD 1612 HAVENHURST - LATE EVENING - ALMOST DARK We move off the door of Aunt Ruth's apartment and crane slowly up to the apartment above hers - WILKINS - the one with the wayward dog. We move closer to Wilkins' apartment and as we move in we hear a phone ringing. DISSOLVE TO: INT. WILKINS' APARTMENT - A MOMENT LATER Wilkins still in his pajamas, bathrobe and slippers from morning slouches in an enormous stuffed chair and matching ottoman, surrounded by piles of papers and coffee cups. His Jack Russell Terrier wakes and stands at the sound of the phone ringing on a side table next to Wilkins. Wilkins comes out of a deep thought and picks up the receiver as he runs his hand through strange, matted tufts of dirty blonde hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. Adam. How's it going? No, it's okay. Yeah, I'm working, but... they wanted this script a week ago. What? What's wrong with your house? The poolman? Sure, you can have the couch. No, it's no problem..it's just I gotta ... I gotta work. Any chance you could bring some food. No, I got plenty of money - I just haven't gone out for awhile. Groovy man!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Murphy and I'll be glad to see you. No, no, no, he's got plenty of food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : INT. AUNT RUTH'S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - NIGHT Rita has just taken the hatbox from the closet shelf and is setting it on the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing? Betty is sitting on the bed opposite. Rita opens the hatbox and removes her purse. She opens the purse and takes out the money. She sits down on the bed and while staring at the money she thinks of what to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've been so good to me ... now we know why ... why I was so afraid. We know what kind of trouble I'm in. I shouldn't... ask you... I only have this to offer. I'll give you this if I can stay here for awhile. I don't know what else to do. Betty moves across the bed to the side of Rita. She puts her arm around Rita and holds her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rita... I want you to stay here and you don't have to give me that money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I want to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. We shouldn't touch that money. We don't know about that money. That might be dangerous money. You have to start all over again. You look like a brand new person and you can be a brand new person... whoever you want to be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It sounds kind of nice ... being somebody brand new.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, let's introduce the brand new you to Hollywood. We haven't seen the roof garden yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EXT.  COURTYARD -  NIGHT The girls come out the front door ... Betty leading and pulling a much happier Rita along with her. They half run across the courtyard to stone steps under an Ivy covered eave. CUT TO: EXT. ROOF GARDEN - NIGHT The girls race up the stone steps toward us. Soon their wind- blown, smiling faces fill the screen as they look out. There before them are the lights of Hollywood with silhouetted palms, slow-moving theater kleig lights, and floating above it all the giant sign in the hills reading HOLLYWOOD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here I am Hollywood! My name's Betty. A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here I am Hollywood! My name is ... Rita. They look out, maybe waiting for an answer blowing in the Santa Ana wind.
direction.name: direction
